channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14273] Rename MVCC to MVCC: From MultiVersionConsistencyControl to MultiVersionConcurrencyControl
item.description: Lars George noticed that our MVCC class has Consistency as the first 'C' when it should be 'Concurrency'. The issue that named this class, HBASE-4544 talks about 'Concurrency' but then it went in as Consistency (Why has no one noticed this before now? Thanks Lars George)
item.summary: Rename MVCC to MVCC: From MultiVersionConsistencyControl to MultiVersionConcurrencyControl

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: If this is a straight renaming then I'm happy to take it.
Renamed. I tried a mvn clean package -DskipTests and that worked just fine.

What versions should we push this into? I'd suggest the unreleased major and minor only, i.e. 1.2 and 2.0 branches. I mean it does not hurt anyone else, and no one has really questioned it. It is internal too, so no API impact. Right?

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12751594/HBASE-14273.patch
against master branch at commit bcef28eefaf192b0ad48c8011f98b8e944340da5.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12751594

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 15 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.0 2.4.1 2.5.0 2.5.1 2.5.2 2.6.0 2.7.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 checkstyle. The applied patch does not increase the total number of checkstyle errors

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn post-site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.TestSplitTransactionOnCluster

-1 core zombie tests. There are 6 zombie test(s): at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestImportExport.testWithFilter(TestImportExport.java:454)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestImportTsv.testMROnTable(TestImportTsv.java:125)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestImportTSVWithVisibilityLabels.testMROnTableWithBulkload(TestImportTSVWithVisibilityLabels.java:235)
at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.security.TestDelegationToken.testDelegationTokenSecretManager(TestDelegationToken.java:117)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestMultithreadedTableMapper.testMultithreadedTableMapper(TestMultithreadedTableMapper.java:133)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestHFileOutputFormat2.testWritingPEData(TestHFileOutputFormat2.java:335)

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15201//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15201//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15201//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15201//console

This message is automatically generated.

I can provide a patch for branch-1 if you want me to.

The test failures seem unrelated to me.
I pushed to master branch. If you do a patch for branch-1, I'll push it there too Lars Francke Thanks.

Pushed to branch-1. Want this in branch-1.2 Sean Busbey? Should be strictly internal. Normally I'd say punt but it'll make the backport of HBASE-12751 easier for Elliott Clark
Applied to 1.2 too. Thanks Lars Francke
